titleStmt.title: F. C. Zacharie to H. D. Newcomb & Co.
CWG2167

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: Having commenced the practice of law, in this city, and being desirous of procuring the appointment as Commissioner of the State of Kentucky for this State, my father J. W. Zacharie has recommended me to ask your kind offices in fowarding, and supporting with any influence that you may have in that quarter, the enclosed application. Should references be needed, I can give the best here, and should you incur any expense in the matter, I will cheerfully refund the same, and be under many obligations to you for your assistance.

Very Resp'y
Yr Obed't Serv't
F. C. Zacharie

H. D. Newcomb & Co
Louisville,
Ky.

New Orleans, Aug. 26th 1865
To His Excellency Gov. Bramlette,
of the State of kentucky:
Being a practicing lawyer in this city, I would respectfully ask to be appointed "Commissioner" for the State of Kentucky, at New Orleans, and in the State of Louisiana.

Very Rep'y
Yr Obedt Serv't
F. C. Zacharie

Comr Deeds
Louisiana
F. C. Zacahrie
apptd
5 ASept/65
